flawed_nl_solution:
By the first two months, 20/100*200 = <<20/100*200=1000/1>>1000/1 mountains had erupted.
The total number of mountains remaining after the first round of explosions is 200-1000/1= <<200-1000/1=-800>>-800
When 40/100 of the remaining mountains exploded, the number of mountains that were still intact decreased by 40/100*-800 = <<40/100*-800=-320>>-320
The number of mountains that hadn't exploded after the second explosions is -800--320 = <<-800--320=-480>>-480
When 50/100 of the mountains which were still intact exploded, the number of mountains that hadn't erupted was reduced by 50/100*-480 = <<50/100*-480=-240>>-240
At the end of the year, -480--240 = <<-480--240=-240>>-240 mountains remained intact and hadn't exploded.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 1000/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
